{"step_by_step_thinking": "Fibrinolytic therapy is a treatment to dissolve dangerous clots in blood vessels, which can prevent damage to tissues and organs. An antidote for fibrinolytic therapy would be a drug that can stop or reverse the effects of fibrinolysis. Epsilon aminocaproic acid is an antifibrinolytic that can inhibit fibrinolysis, making it an antidote for fibrinolytic therapy. Protamine is an antidote for heparin, not fibrinolytic therapy. Heparin is an anticoagulant, not an antidote for fibrinolytic therapy. Streptokinase is a fibrinolytic agent, not an antidote for fibrinolytic therapy.", "answer_choice": "A"}
